roleset.name: to reduce to a general form
roleset.note: GENERALIZE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'generalize' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from generalize.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: generalize-v: intransitive
example.text: It [*EXP*-1] 's hard [*]to generalize , but age seems [*-2] to be the best predictor .

example.name: generalize-v: transitive
example.text: It [*EXP*-2] 's hard [*]to generalize about a reasonable price for puts .
example.arg: about a reasonable price for puts

example.name: generalization-n: all args
example.text: Another such instance is his generalization of Kummer's “ideal prime factors” to arbitrary algebraic number fields.

roleset.name: shared by, common, usual
roleset.note: GENERAL-J NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to common.01 and common.03. Framed by Katie. (from general.01-j)

example.name: both args
example.text: The perception deficit was general to all patients in the trial group.
example.arg: to all patients in the trial group.

example.name: arg 1 only
example.text: The toxicity is both general and specific.
